author: Peter Wright
content: It is not often you can measure a dog poop in London buses.

author: Jean-Pierre Declemy
content: Our dalmation dog (not renowned for their intelligence) chewed up and ate a whole child’s toy, a red London double-decker bus. His poop was flecked with bright red plastic for a few days. Plastic not affected by gastric juices.

author: Phil
content: I have doubts the memory stick was eaten and passed through the seal, stomach acid is pretty strong stuff.

author: dennis
content: who’s the manufacturer? bet their marketing group would jump on that promotion hahaha

author: Jean-Pierre Declemy
content: Did they check the poop for traces of human, kayak and camera?

author: Peter Wright
content:
I genuinely hope the owner is still alive, leopard seals are pretty brutal.

https://news.nationalgeographic.com/news/2003/08/leopard-seal-kills-scientist-in-antarctica/

author: Phil
content:
No big deal, nothing but digested sealife.
They want the poop to test the anmal’s diet and health.

If you ever want or need to be checked for worms, doctors need yours too!
